---
title: "Análise de Sobrevivência"
subtitle: "Modelos Paramétricos TFA (AFT)"
author: "Ricardo Accioly"
format:
 html:
    code-link: true
    fig-width: 9
    fig-height: 7
    fig-dpi: 300
knitr:
  opts_chunk: 
    out.width: 90%
    comment: "#>"
---


## Modelos TFA

O conjunto de dados carregados a seguir são de 238 pacientes viciados com heroína.

Os pacientes foram tratados em duas clínicas (1 e 2), além disso foram coletadas informações sobre dose de medicamento ministrado no tratamento e se o paciente já havia sido preso ou não.

Os tempos (`survt`) são em dias e o evento analisado foi o tempo até a saída da clínica (status=1) ou o tempo até o término de estudo (tempo censurado (status=0).

-   id: Identificação do paciente
-   clinic: clinica em que ocorreu o tratamento
-   survt: tempo até a saída da clínica (dias)
-   status: censoring status 0=censored (censurado), 1=evento
-   prison: 0= se nunca foi preso e 1= se já foi preso
-   dose: dose do medicamento ministradp

## Carregando os dados


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
library(survival)
library(readxl)
dados <- read_xlsx("heroina.xlsx", col_names = TRUE )
summary(dados)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#>        id             clinic          status           survt       
#>  Min.   :  1.00   Min.   :1.000   Min.   :0.0000   Min.   :   2.0  
#>  1st Qu.: 65.25   1st Qu.:1.000   1st Qu.:0.0000   1st Qu.: 171.2  
#>  Median :131.50   Median :1.000   Median :1.0000   Median : 367.5  
#>  Mean   :134.13   Mean   :1.315   Mean   :0.6303   Mean   : 402.6  
#>  3rd Qu.:205.75   3rd Qu.:2.000   3rd Qu.:1.0000   3rd Qu.: 585.5  
#>  Max.   :266.00   Max.   :2.000   Max.   :1.0000   Max.   :1076.0  
#>      prison            dose      
#>  Min.   :0.0000   Min.   : 20.0  
#>  1st Qu.:0.0000   1st Qu.: 50.0  
#>  Median :0.0000   Median : 60.0  
#>  Mean   :0.4664   Mean   : 60.4  
#>  3rd Qu.:1.0000   3rd Qu.: 70.0  
#>  Max.   :1.0000   Max.   :110.0
```
:::
:::


## Avaliando presença de dados ausentes


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
nrow(dados)
sum(complete.cases(dados))
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 238
#> [1] 238
```
:::
:::


## Ajuste do Modelo Exponencial


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
ajustExp <- survreg(Surv(survt,status)~1,dist='exponential', data=dados)
ajustExp
alfa <- exp(ajustExp$coefficients[1])
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ 1, data = dados, dist = "exponential")
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#> (Intercept) 
#>    6.459508 
#> 
#> Scale fixed at 1 
#> 
#> Loglik(model)= -1118.9   Loglik(intercept only)= -1118.9
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::


## Ajuste do Modelo Weibull


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
ajustWei <- survreg(Surv(survt, status)~1,dist='weibull', data=dados)
ajustWei
alfaw <- exp(ajustWei$coefficients[1])
betaw <- 1/ajustWei$scale
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ 1, data = dados, dist = "weibull")
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#> (Intercept) 
#>    6.425148 
#> 
#> Scale= 0.8153819 
#> 
#> Loglik(model)= -1114.9   Loglik(intercept only)= -1114.9
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::


## Ajuste do Modelo Lognormal


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
ajustLog <- survreg(Surv(survt,status)~1,dist='lognorm', data=dados)
ajustLog
mu <- ajustLog$icoef[1]
sigma <- exp(ajustLog$icoef[2])
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ 1, data = dados, dist = "lognorm")
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#> (Intercept) 
#>    6.059725 
#> 
#> Scale= 1.210284 
#> 
#> Loglik(model)= -1123.7   Loglik(intercept only)= -1123.7
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::


## Ajuste do Modelo Loglogístico


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
ajustLogl <- survreg(Surv(survt,status)~1, data=dados, dist='loglogistic')
ajustLogl
mu1 <- ajustLogl$icoef[1]
sigma1 <- exp(ajustLogl$icoef[2])
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ 1, data = dados, dist = "loglogistic")
#> 
#> Coefficients:
#> (Intercept) 
#>     6.09544 
#> 
#> Scale= 0.6637981 
#> 
#> Loglik(model)= -1120   Loglik(intercept only)= -1120
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::


## Comparação dos Modelos {.scrollable}


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
ekm <- survfit(Surv(survt,status)~1, data=dados)
tempo <- ekm$time
st <- ekm$surv
ste <- exp(-tempo/alfa)
stw <- exp(-(tempo/alfaw)^betaw)
stln <- pnorm((-log(tempo) + mu)/sigma)
stll <- plogis((-log(tempo) + mu1)/sigma1)
knitr::kable(head(cbind(tempo,st,ste,stw,stln,stll),15))
```
````

::: {.cell-output-display}
| tempo|        st|       ste|       stw|      stln|      stll|
|-----:|---------:|---------:|---------:|---------:|---------:|
|     2| 1.0000000| 0.9968738| 0.9991153| 0.9999954| 0.9997080|
|     7| 0.9957627| 0.9891009| 0.9958947| 0.9996619| 0.9980756|
|    13| 0.9915254| 0.9798534| 0.9912492| 0.9980588| 0.9951244|
|    17| 0.9872881| 0.9737364| 0.9878608| 0.9961610| 0.9927140|
|    19| 0.9830508| 0.9706923| 0.9860991| 0.9949737| 0.9913963|
|    26| 0.9788136| 0.9601126| 0.9796444| 0.9896895| 0.9862708|
|    28| 0.9788136| 0.9571111| 0.9777293| 0.9878899| 0.9846741|
|    29| 0.9745393| 0.9556138| 0.9767614| 0.9869468| 0.9838555|
|    30| 0.9702650| 0.9541189| 0.9757869| 0.9859760| 0.9830239|
|    33| 0.9659907| 0.9496482| 0.9728257| 0.9829067| 0.9804540|
|    35| 0.9574421| 0.9466794| 0.9708222| 0.9807385| 0.9786809|
|    37| 0.9531678| 0.9437198| 0.9687968| 0.9784805| 0.9768624|
|    41| 0.9446192| 0.9378285| 0.9646851| 0.9737197| 0.9730969|
|    47| 0.9403449| 0.9290603| 0.9583814| 0.9660499| 0.9671529|
|    49| 0.9360706| 0.9261559| 0.9562475| 0.9633723| 0.9650990|
:::
:::


## Comparação dos Modelos


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
par(mfrow=c(2,2))
plot(st,ste,pch=16,ylim=range(c(0.0,1)), xlim=range(c(0,1)), xlab = "S(t): Kaplan-Meier", ylab="S(t): exponencial")
lines(c(0,1), c(0,1), type="l", lty=1)
plot(st,stw,pch=16,ylim=range(c(0.0,1)), xlim=range(c(0,1)), xlab = "S(t): Kaplan-Meier",
     ylab="S(t): Weibull")
lines(c(0,1), c(0,1), type="l", lty=1)
plot(st,stln,pch=16,ylim=range(c(0.0,1)), xlim=range(c(0,1)), xlab = "S(t): Kaplan-Meier",
     ylab="S(t): log-normal")
lines(c(0,1), c(0,1), type="l", lty=1)
plot(st,stll,pch=16,ylim=range(c(0.0,1)), xlim=range(c(0,1)), 
     xlab = "S(t): Kaplan-Meier", ylab="S(t): loglogística")
lines(c(0,1), c(0,1), type="l", lty=1)
```
````

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06x1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Comparação dos Modelos


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
par(mfrow=c(1,3))
tab.np <- summary(ekm)
invst1 <- qnorm(tab.np$surv)
invst2 <- qlogis(tab.np$surv) 
plot(log(tab.np$time), log(-log(tab.np$surv)),
     xlab="log(t)", ylab="log(-log(S(t)))", pch=20)
plot(log(tab.np$time), invst1,
     xlab="log(t)", ylab=expression(Phi^-1*(S(t))), pch=20)
plot(log(tab.np$time), invst2,
     xlab="log(t)", ylab=expression(Phi^-1*Logis*(S(t))), pch=20)
```
````

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06x1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Modelo Weibull


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
TFAWei <- survreg(Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + dose,
                   dist = "weibull", 
                   data=dados)
summary(TFAWei)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + 
#>     dose, data = dados, dist = "weibull")
#>                    Value Std. Error     z       p
#> (Intercept)      4.10485    0.32806 12.51 < 2e-16
#> clinic           0.70904    0.15722  4.51 6.5e-06
#> factor(prison)1 -0.22947    0.12079 -1.90   0.057
#> dose             0.02443    0.00459  5.32 1.0e-07
#> Log(scale)      -0.31495    0.06756 -4.66 3.1e-06
#> 
#> Scale= 0.73 
#> 
#> Weibull distribution
#> Loglik(model)= -1084.5   Loglik(intercept only)= -1114.9
#> 	Chisq= 60.89 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 3.8e-13 
#> Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 7 
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::


## Previsões


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
novosdados <- data.frame(clinic = c("1", "2"),
                         prison = factor(c(0, 0)), dose = c(60, 60))
previs <- predict(TFAWei, type = "quantile", 
                  newdata = novosdados, p = 0.5)
previs
previs[2]/previs[1]
previs <- predict(TFAWei, type = "quantile", 
                  newdata = novosdados, p = 0.7)
previs
previs[2]/previs[1]
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#>        1        2 
#> 200.9142 408.2661 
#>        2 
#> 2.032042 
#>        1        2 
#> 300.6186 610.8697 
#>        2 
#> 2.032042
```
:::
:::


## Função auxiliar


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
smoothSEcurve <- function(yy, xx) {
# usar depois de chamar um grafico
# Ajusta um curva lowess curve com IC de 95%
## Facilita a avaliação dos resíduos
xx.list <- min(xx) + ((0:100)/100)*(max(xx) - min(xx))
yy.xx <- predict(loess(yy ~ xx), se=T,
newdata=data.frame(xx=xx.list))
lines(yy.xx$fit ~ xx.list, lwd=2)
lines(yy.xx$fit -
qt(0.975, yy.xx$df)*yy.xx$se.fit ~ xx.list, lty=2)
lines(yy.xx$fit +
qt(0.975, yy.xx$df)*yy.xx$se.fit ~ xx.list, lty=2)
}
```
:::


## Diagnóstico do Modelo


::: {.cell output-location='slide'}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
#| output-location: slide
#| fig-width: 15
#| fig-height: 8
library(car)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}
```
#> Carregando pacotes exigidos: carData
```
:::

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
#| output-location: slide
#| fig-width: 15
#| fig-height: 8
par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.6)
pred.lin <- predict(TFAWei, type = "lp")[dados$status == 1]
log.resid <- log(dados$survt[dados$status == 1]) - pred.lin
plot(pred.lin, log.resid, main = "Grafico TA",
xlab = "log(valores ajustados)", ylab = "log(residuos)")
smoothSEcurve(log.resid, pred.lin)
qqPlot(exp(log.resid), dist = "weibull",
shape = 1/TFAWei$scale,
main = "Grafico Q-Q", xlab = "Quantis teoricos Weibull", ylab = "Quantis empiricos")
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1] 69  8
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06x1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Modelo Lognormal


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
TFALn <- survreg(Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + dose,
                   dist = "lognormal", 
                   data=dados)
summary(TFALn)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + 
#>     dose, data = dados, dist = "lognormal")
#>                    Value Std. Error     z      p
#> (Intercept)      3.40684    0.39769  8.57 <2e-16
#> clinic           0.57649    0.17648  3.27 0.0011
#> factor(prison)1 -0.30904    0.15431 -2.00 0.0452
#> dose             0.03367    0.00568  5.93  3e-09
#> Log(scale)       0.07476    0.05930  1.26 0.2074
#> 
#> Scale= 1.08 
#> 
#> Log Normal distribution
#> Loglik(model)= -1097.8   Loglik(intercept only)= -1123.7
#> 	Chisq= 51.85 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 3.2e-11 
#> Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 4 
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::


## Previsões


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
novosdados <- data.frame(clinic = c("1", "2"),
                         prison = factor(c(0, 0)), dose = c(60, 60))
previs <- predict(TFALn, type = "quantile", 
                  newdata = novosdados, p = 0.5)
previs
previs[2]/previs[1]
previs <- predict(TFALn, type = "quantile", 
                  newdata = novosdados, p = 0.7)
previs
previs[2]/previs[1]
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#>        1        2 
#> 227.5381 404.9681 
#>        2 
#> 1.779782 
#>        1        2 
#> 400.3836 712.5953 
#>        2 
#> 1.779782
```
:::
:::


## Diagnóstico do Modelo


::: {.cell output-location='slide'}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
#| output-location: slide
#| fig-width: 15
#| fig-height: 8
par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.6)
pred.lin <- predict(TFALn, type = "lp")[dados$status == 1]
log.resid <- log(dados$survt[dados$status == 1]) - pred.lin
plot(pred.lin, log.resid, main = "Grafico TA",
xlab = "log(valores ajustados)", ylab = "log(residuos)")
smoothSEcurve(log.resid, pred.lin)
qqPlot(log.resid, dist = "norm", sd=TFALn$scale, 
main = "Grafico Q-Q", xlab = "Quantis teoricos Lognormal", ylab = "Quantis empiricos")
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> [1]  86 110
```
:::

::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Aula06x1_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=90%}
:::
:::


## Modeleo Loglogistico


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
TFALl <- survreg(Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + dose,
                   dist = "loglogistic", 
                   data=dados)
summary(TFALl)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + 
#>     dose, data = dados, dist = "loglogistic")
#>                    Value Std. Error     z       p
#> (Intercept)      3.56327    0.38945  9.15 < 2e-16
#> clinic           0.58060    0.17157  3.38 0.00071
#> factor(prison)1 -0.29127    0.14396 -2.02 0.04305
#> dose             0.03161    0.00552  5.73 1.0e-08
#> Log(scale)      -0.53314    0.06863 -7.77 7.9e-15
#> 
#> Scale= 0.587 
#> 
#> Log logistic distribution
#> Loglik(model)= -1093.9   Loglik(intercept only)= -1120
#> 	Chisq= 52.18 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 2.7e-11 
#> Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 4 
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::


## Previsões


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
novosdados <- data.frame(clinic = c("1", "2"),
                         prison = factor(c(0, 0)), dose = c(60, 60))
previs <- predict(TFALl, type = "quantile", 
                  newdata = novosdados, p = 0.5)
previs
previs[2]/previs[1]
previs <- predict(TFALl, type = "quantile", 
                  newdata = novosdados, p = 0.7)
previs
previs[2]/previs[1]
```
````

## Diagnóstico do Modelo


::: {.cell output-location='slide'}

````{.cell-code}

#| output-location: slide

par(mfrow = c(1, 2), cex = 0.6)
pred.lin <- predict(TFALl, type = "lp")[dados$status == 1]
log.resid <- log(dados$survt[dados$status == 1]) - pred.lin
````

## Usando o stepAIC


::: {.cell}

````{.cell-code}
```{{r}}
library(MASS)
TFAWei <- survreg(Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + dose,
                   dist = "weibull", 
                   data=dados)
TFAWei_AIC <- stepAIC(TFAWei, trace=FALSE)
summary(TFAWei_AIC)
```
````

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 
#> Call:
#> survreg(formula = Surv(survt, status) ~ clinic + factor(prison) + 
#>     dose, data = dados, dist = "weibull")
#>                    Value Std. Error     z       p
#> (Intercept)      4.10485    0.32806 12.51 < 2e-16
#> clinic           0.70904    0.15722  4.51 6.5e-06
#> factor(prison)1 -0.22947    0.12079 -1.90   0.057
#> dose             0.02443    0.00459  5.32 1.0e-07
#> Log(scale)      -0.31495    0.06756 -4.66 3.1e-06
#> 
#> Scale= 0.73 
#> 
#> Weibull distribution
#> Loglik(model)= -1084.5   Loglik(intercept only)= -1114.9
#> 	Chisq= 60.89 on 3 degrees of freedom, p= 3.8e-13 
#> Number of Newton-Raphson Iterations: 7 
#> n= 238
```
:::
:::
